citations.narrative:
Upon initiating the renewal process for the licensee, it was revealed that the licensee relocated to a new site and
conducted regulated activity without notifying Animal Care (AC). The licensee currently has two sites whereby licensed
activity is conducted. Failure to inform AC about relocation of the facility and/or animals impedes the inspection and
regulatory processes that ensure the health and well-being of the animals. Licenses are issued to specific persons, and
are issued for specific activities, types and numbers of animals, and approved sites. A licensee shall notify AC no fewer
than 90 days and obtain a new license before any change in address as described in paragraph (b)(2).
This inspection was a site approval inspection.
This site is not ready for approval to conduct activity covered under your current Animal Welfare Act License.
Conducting regulated activities at a non-approved site is a violation of the Animal Welfare Act.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next new site approval inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
